Pay, benefits and more:


* Competitive compensation package

* Earn up to 15 days of PTO over your first year
* 10 paid company holidays
* 401(k) option with company match

What you’ll do on a typical day:

* Lead and supervise all aspects of freight operations, including inbound/outbound processing, loading, unloading and processing of customer shipments.
* Develop and implement strategic work procedures to meet the evolving demands of the department.
* Evaluate and assign driver routes
* Manage, assign and supervise pickups and deliveries in the local area
* Supervise hourly staff during various inbound, city and/or outbound freight operations and act as primary point of contact for workplace concerns and questions
* Ensure production goals are met by managing tonnage, payroll and other administrative functions
* Plan hourly employee schedules to meet daily operations goals and lower costs
* Enforce all company, FMCSR, OSHA, CCMTA, NSC and DOT policies, rules, regulations and laws
* Implement all applicable XPO workplace policies and procedures and enforce compliance with same
* Ensure customer freight is delivered and picked up timely and damage free.
* Coach, train and develop employees on proper loading/unloading techniques and productivity, safety, efficiency and quality requirements, including conducting new hire employee evaluations and determining whether to issue, and preparing, corrective action for violations of XPO’s attendance, safety, accountability in the workplace and other workplace policies
* Effectively direct a team to consistently meet or exceed productivity goals
* Make recommendations regarding hiring, suspension and firing
* Develop and present action plans to improve load average and model compliance
* Participate in internal safety committees and engagement committees
* Train employees on safety rules and processes
* Monitor and maintain housekeeping within the shift to ensure safety and productivity
* Conduct daily staff meetings and communicate corporate messages and revisions to policies and procedures to all team members
* Inspect working conditions of tools and equipment needed for safe operation within the area and directs the correction of any improper or adverse condition that exists
* Provide instruction, analyses, suggestions and ideas for improvement of operations within the shift and the service center
* Act as a champion of our values, demonstrating them and holding your team to the same high standards

  

Freight Operations Supervisors are required to:

* Lift objects of various shapes, sizes and weights frequently up to 50 lbs. and occasionally greater than 75 lbs.
* Reach (including above your head), bend, climb, push, pull, twist, squat and kneel
* Walk and stand for extended periods on a loading dock that is not climate-controlled and may be slippery
* Work outside in inclement weather

XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. title: Technical Assistant - Photography
company: The Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
description:
Posted On: September 9, 2024


Hours: Part Time


Description:


JOB SUMMARY  

The Technical Assistant is responsible for supporting students and faculty with equipment and facilities in the Photography area. This includes ensuring the labs and classrooms are maintained as clean and safe environments. This is a hands-position that involves checking in and out equipment, instructing users on proper equipment use, performing routine maintenance and troubleshooting, and working collaboratively with colleagues on day-to-day operations.

  

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES  

* Assist students and faculty with the use of equipment and facilities. This includes providing general technical support and guidance for relevant courses, photo editing and scanning software support, and fulfilling student print orders.
* Check equipment in and out to students, including providing technical support to students and answering questions on the correct care and opera tion of equipment.
* Work cooperatively with head technician and technical staff to ensure adequate coverage of the labs, including overseeing work-study students.


Maintenance and inventory support  

* Perform routine maintenance and troubleshooting for all equipment, including software updates, calibration of computer monitors, media projectors, scanners and inkjet printers.
* Revise and update written tutorials for all software and hardware used in the digital photo lab as needed.
* Create custom color profiles using color management hardware and software.
* Conduct inventory management, including usage of printer ink and paper, and generally ensure equipment is in good working condition.
* Work cooperatively with head technician and technical staff to ensure maintenance is conducted in a timely manner.


Lab and classroom support  

* Assist with the safe and clean operation of the technical facilities and classrooms, which includes the computer lab and darkrooms.
* Prepare photo labs for class lectures and demonstrations according to instructors’ needs.
* Open and close all photography facilities as needed.
  

OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES AS NEEDED  

* Provide hands-on technical assistance and advice on related special projects, such as senior presentations, student shows, and the End of Year Show.
  

SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS  

* Basic repair/maintenance skills and solid proficiency with a wide variety of digital and film-based photographic media and equipment. Including a proficiency in troubleshooting information technologies and photo-specific digital processes and equipment.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and a color-managed digital workflow.
* Experience working or managing both digital and traditional darkrooms with a basic understanding of appropriate chemical handling and lab health-and-safety standards.
* Experience with Epson Stylus Pro inkjet printers, Epson scanners, and Nikon and Hasselblad/Flextight film scanners, including experience with making exhibition quality photographic prints.
* Experience with equipment checkout systems and software, service-desk management.
* Good organizational skills and the ability to maintain a clean, orderly photography lab from opening to closing.
* Experience assisting individuals with varying levels of technical abilities.
* Ability and aptitude for hands-on problem-solving to help students achieve their project goals using existing equipment and software, including synthesizing photographic and non- photographic processes.
* Needs to be flexible and willing to learn and adapt to the existing educational environment and its needs and schedule.
* Excellent oral and written skills, communication skills, collegial, capacity to work both independently and collectively, and comfortable working in a busy environment.
* Strong ability to work with a diverse community of students, staff, and faculty with a high degree of cultural competency.
  

EDUCATION  

* BA/BFA Photography, New Media, or related field preferred
  

Position runs from September through May.


15 hours per week.


Pay: $24.76 per hour


This is a unionized position.
